title: 传送门Portal Mod的一些问题
author: tedlc
txt_content:
我按着作者的说明成功的做了一个1.8的传送门服务器，作者说有一个里面有个mod_PortalGun.properties文件可以设置各种物品的属性，我试了一下，可以设置，但是仅仅更改了单人模式的设置。服务器里也有一个mod_PortalGun.properties文件，但是里面的内容不一样，我试着改了一下但是没有作用。我现在想在服务器中设置一下分解网的属性，让他能分解经过的玩家身上除了传送门枪以外的所有物品（为了测试，防止他从房间里带出东西到下一个房间），单人模式只要把gridMode = 2这个更改一下就好了，可是联机没有用。我想，如果测试的话必须得联机吧……要不然我自虐啊……谁会弄，帮帮忙。我只是想像Galdos一样做一个自己的测试来整别人而已……
这是服务器的文件：
#Portal Gun 1.8.1v1 - Global Settings
#Sun Oct 02 08:47:05 CST 2011
portalheptID=207
portalsignID=209
portalhepcID=208
portalafpID=212
portalspawnerID=210
portal2recordID=2011
portalcubeID=205
portalcheckpointID=211
portalrecord2ID=2012
portalrecordID=2013
portalbaseitemsID=13200
portalgridID=206
portalblockID=204

而单人模式的文件更丰富：
# Key to press to "flick the switch"
# Default: G
portalgunswapKey = F
# Key to press to reboot the gun
# Default: R
portalgunrebootKey = R
# Block IDs
# Default: 204 - 210, Range: 1-255, BlockIDs+ not required, Type: integer
portalblockID = 204
portalcubeID = 205
portalgridID = 206
portalheptID = 207
portalhepcID = 208
portalsignID = 209
portalspawnerID = 210
portalcheckpointID = 211
portalafpID = 212
# Item ID base
# Items start using the ID... Default: 13200
portalbaseitemsID = 13200
# Record ID
# Range: 2002 to 2015; Default: 2013 to 2011
portalrecordID = 2013
portalrecord2ID = 2012
portal2recordID = 2011
# Grid mode.
# Mode 1 = Just remove portals.
# Mode 2 = Destroy everything except worn armor and gun + Mode 1.
# Mode 3 = Destroy everything except your stuff + Mode 1.
# Mode 4 = Destroy everything except worn armor, gun and living creatures + Mode 1.
# Mode 5 = Destroy everything except your stuff and living creatures + Mode 1.
# Default: 1.
gridMode = 2
# Gun mode.
# Mode 1 = G (default) to swap guns to fire.
# Mode 2 = Left click fires blue, Right click fires red/orange
# Default: 1.
gunMode = 2
# HEP mode.
# Mode 1 = Kill everything.
# Mode 2 = Kill everything except you.
# Mode 3 = Knockback everything.
# Mode 4 = Knockback everything except you.
# Default: 1.
hepMode = 1
# Respawn with gun?
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 0.
gunRespawn = 0
# Swing arm when firing portal(Only for gun mode 1)?
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 0
swingArm = 0
# Floor and Ceiling portals can take 2 spaces?
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 1
dualPortals = 1
# Can portals be shot through glass?
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 0
throughGlass = 0
# Will MEGs(grids) have bounding boxes?
# Yes: Advantage - No placing blocks through grids.
# Yes: Advantage - You can place a block on top easily.
# Yes: Disadvantage - Looks ugly.
# No: Opposite of Yes.
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 1
gridBox = 1
# Mode for unportalbleID.
# 1 = Blacklist.
# 2 = Whitelist.
# Default: 1
unportalbleMode = 1
# A blacklist or whitelist for portal placement. (Blacklist = Can't place portals on, Whitelis = Can only place portals on)
# Blacklist/whitelist is defined in unportalbleMode option above.
# Obsidian is 49. Get the whole list here. http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Data_values
# Format: int, int, int (eg: 2, 3, 12)
# If none leave it as 0.
# Default: 0.
unportalbleID = 0
# Turret Mode
# The higher the mode, the more exceptions it makes.
# Mode 1 = Attacks everything.
# Mode 2 = Ignores you and your pet wolves.
# Mode 3 = Ignores animals.
# Mode 4 = Ignores mobs.
# Default: 1.
turretMode = 1
# Does the turret shoot at its target if the target is behind glass?
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 1.
turretShootsGlass = 1
# Enable Achievements?
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 1.
haveAchievements = 1
# How far can turrets see? (in blocks)
# Default: 50.
turretRange = 50
# Do turrets drop themselves as an item when they die?
# 0 = No
# 1 = Yes
# Default: 0.
turretDrops = 0
# Will turrets hurt you or knock you back?
# 0 = Knock back
# Any number larger than 0 (only integers) = Hurts X number of hearts.
# Default: 1.
turretHurts = 1
# How near (blocks) do you have to be to be able to hear the serenade?
# Default: 75.
serenadeRange = 75
# Does the serenade only occur when you can be seen?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 0
serenadeWhenSeen = 0
# Overlay crosshair with Portal status when equipped with PortalGun?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes, Portal 1 style, more extensive.
# 2 = Yes, Portal 2 style, less extensive.
# Default: 2
portalsOverlay = 2
# Auto merge two single coloured Portal Guns?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 1
autoMergeGuns = 1
# Magnitude of turret's explosion when on fire
# Creeper = 30, Charged creeper = 60
# Default: 15
turretExplosionMag = 15
# Does the Portal Gun Pedestal disappear when you take the Portal Gun it has?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# 2 = Yes, and drop itself as an item.
# Default: 0
autoKillAPG = 0
# Chance of spawning a Oracle Turret. (Lower number means higher chance, 0 means every time)
# -1 = Disabled.
# 0 = Every time.
# Default: 10
differentChance = 10
# Are Checkpoint Blocks enabled?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 1
enableCheckpoints = 1
# Do checkpoints display a message when a new one is set?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 0
checkpointMessage = 0
# Do checkpoints temporarily create a checkpoint or permanently change your spawn point?
# 1 = Temporary.
# 2 = Permanent.
# Default: 1
checkpointMode = 1
# Do checkpoints erase portals when you respawn on them?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 0
checkpointErasesPortals = 0
# Do Aerial Faith Plates need to be powered with redstone to work?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 0
AFPredstone = 0
# Is the radio invincible? (Hitting it with a pickaxe still breaks it)
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 0
isRadioInvincible = 0
# Is reset portals key enabled? (Single coloured portal guns can't reset portals)
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 1
isResetKeyEnabled = 1
# Do portals on spawners close if redstone power supplied to them is stopped?
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 0
spawnerPower = 1
# Will getting launched by an Aerial Faith Plate lock your motion keys? (Good for maps)
# 0 = No.
# 1 = Yes.
# Default: 0
lockKeyAFP = 0
# Randomly generated Personal Portal Colours or user defined?
# 0 = Random.
# 1 = User defined.
# Default: 0
customPortalColour = 0
# Personal Portal Colours (user defined)
# Format \#xxxxxx. Hexadecimal colours (Google it if you don't understand)
customColour1 = \#ffffff
customColour2 = \#ffffff
